entry.title: Re: Automatic Triggering of Release Universal Journal
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Finance for Group Reporting doesn't have a standard program to extract consolidated data from ACDOCA for file upload to ACDOCU in a way that directly mimics the EC-CS process for external upload. This is because Group Reporting is designed for direct integration and real-time consolidation within S/4HANA, primarily leveraging ACDOCA as its source.

Try custom route..

Since you're on S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud, developing a custom ABAP program is the most flexible and robust solution.
Logic: The program would read relevant data from ACDOCA based on your consolidation-specific criteria (e.g., company codes, consolidation chart of accounts, GL accounts, posting periods, transaction types, partner information). It would then transform and format this data into the structure required for upload to ACDOCU.
Output Format: You can program it to output the data in a CSV or XML file format, which can then be used for upload.
Key Considerations:
-Mapping: You'll need to define clear mapping rules between ACDOCA fields and ACDOCU fields, considering dimensions like Consolidation Unit, Partner Consolidation Unit, Consolidation G/L Account, Transaction Type, etc.
-Data Aggregation/Transformation: Depending on your reporting requirements, you might need to aggregate certain accounts or perform specific transformations (e.g., currency translation if not already handled by Group Reporting's real-time processes, or reclassifications).
-Selection Criteria: Ensure robust selection parameters for company codes, fiscal periods, and other relevant master data to extract only the necessary data.
-Performance: For large volumes of data, optimize the program for performance.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

Try custom route..

Since you're on S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud, developing a custom ABAP program is the most flexible and robust solution.
Logic: The program would read relevant data from ACDOCA based on your consolidation-specific criteria (e.g., company codes, consolidation chart of accounts, GL accounts, posting periods, transaction types, partner information). entry.title: Re: Depreciation not posted in some Depreciation Areas
entry.content:
Hi @bjaganathan1 ,

Please verify couple of things..

1. Check Depreciation Area Settings - Transaction OADB
Verify whether the new depreciation areas are set to post to G/L. If "Post to G/L" is not checked, no depreciation entries will be posted, even if values are calculated.

2. Check Accounting Principle Assignment to Depreciation Areas
In S/4HANA (and ECC pre-S/4 with New GL), depreciation areas are linked to accounting principles. Use Transaction: S_ALR_87009183 or View: V_T093C. Ensure that the correct accounting principle is assigned. The depreciation area is linked to the correct ledger.
If the area isn't linked to a ledger, it will calculate values but not post.

3. Check Depreciation Key Settings - Go to AFAMA
Ensure depreciation keys in new areas are active and properly configured. Check for calculation method, Useful life, base method, declining/balancing
A blank or misconfigured key can prevent depreciation from being calculated or posted.

4. Check Posting Rules for Each Area (Transaction AO90)
Posting rules determine which accounts are used when posting depreciation. If the posting rule is missing or incomplete for the area, depreciation will not post.
Ensure entries exist for:
-Transaction type: 70 (Ordinary depreciation)
-Dep. area-specific GL mapping

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Elevating HR’s role in the C-suite
entry.content:
While many HR executives have successfully earned their “seat at the C-suite table,” some C-suite executives don’t view HR as an equal partner. Understanding this viewpoint is critical to realizing business outcomes through a healthy and productive strategic partnership.

Using data from C-suite leaders (e.g., CFOs, CEOs, CIOs, COOs, CHROs) across the globe from companies of all sizes, the Future of Work Research Lab has provided evidence-based recommendations for HR leaders seeking to elevate their partnership with the C-suite through technological advancements and cross-functional collaborations. Explore our findings to improve your relationships and business outcomes.

Opportunities for HR partnership

  • 38% of executives are satisfied with their level of integration of people and business performance data
  • 52% of C-suite leaders say that more collaboration on projects within their own function would most improve the quality of their partnership
  • 92% of the C-suite believe that HR is somewhat or very critical in the successful adoption of AI across the workforce

Learn more about how the C-suite wants increased integration between people data and business performance, and how HR can elevate its role as a strategic partner in the C-suite.

Check out the full set of assets, including the overview video, infographic, blog, and the replay to the “Connecting People, Data, and Processes with SAP Business Suite for HR” webinar.

entry.title: Re: Badi FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALIDATION does not have necessar...
entry.content:
Hi @Aish16 ,

Try Badi - FI_OUTGOING_PAYMENT_VALIDATION

Logic..
1.Get the House Bank and Account ID from the current payment being processed (this should be available in the payment header or a specific parameter of this BAdI).
2.Loop through the OPEN_ITEMS (vendor invoices) being selected for payment.
3.For each invoice, you'll need to read the original invoice document (from ACDOCA).
-How to read ACDOCA: You cannot directly SELECT * FROM ACDOCA in a custom BAdI in Public Cloud. You must use released CDS Views or APIs for data access.
-Identify the CDS view that exposes the vendor invoice details. Common ones include I_JournalEntryItem or views specifically designed for supplier invoices.
-The challenge: House bank is not a standard field on the vendor invoice line item in ACDOCA or related views. The house bank is typically determined at the time of payment or is part of your own bank details (for customer payments) or vendor's bank details (for supplier payments).

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Ensuring Exam Access Only After Class Completion
entry.content:
Hello experts

We have this client request: The client requires that, in a blended item, a learner should not be able to access the associated assessment without first completing a class.

Scenarios:

Scenario 1

The learner attends the class and passes it.

The learner gains access to the exam.

Scenario 2

The learner attends the class but does not pass it.

The learner does not gain access to the exam.

The learner is enrolled in another class (for the same item).

After passing it, the learner gains access to the exam.

 

Options evaluated so far:

1. Using prerequisites between components.

2. Splitting components into separate items (one for the class and another for the exam).

3. Using the instructor’s verification code (proctor code).

4. Enabling the exam only in a specific segment of the class.

Question: Do you have any additional options or alternative approaches that could fulfill this access control requirement?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: 2508 Early Release Series for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network releases
entry.content:
Sign up now for the 2508 Early Release Series

Follow this blog to receive notification of new series as soon as registration opens.

 

 

 

 

 

 

SAP strives to equip our customers and partners with valuable release readiness resources for each SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network quarterly release.

Early Release Series

The Early Release Series webcasts cover features planned for the upcoming SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network quarterly release.  This platform, available to customers and partners, has a clear mission: deliver an interactive forum to engage with SAP product experts providing simple, direct answers to your most pressing questions.  There is a different session for each product area with content tailored for the specific audience:

  • Supplier Management & Risk
  • Procure to Pay
  • Source to Contract

Note: With this release, the Early Release Series will not include a SAP Business Network session.

If you want to learn more and actively engage with SAP subject matter experts, we encourage you to participate in these informative sessions.  Register now!

Quarterly Release Communications

Notice of upcoming quarterly releases will be communicated to Buyer customers three weeks prior to the release date.  Suppliers receive notice two weeks prior.  Releases are communicated via email notification (look for subject line starting with: Advance Release Notice).

Anyone from your organization that has chosen to subscribe to product notifications will receive these announcements. 

The release calendar for SAP Business Network  and release calendar SAP Ariba Applications identify release timing several quarters in advance.

Where to find out more details?

On demand replays of webcasts from completed quarterly releases can be consumed from Release Readiness Resources: Webcast Archive Page

entry.title: How to prevent deletion of specific entry in Event 03 (Table Maintenance) when choose multiple rows
entry.content:
Hi experts, I am using Event 03: Before Deleting the Data for my table ZSAP03_EMAIL Now I write this FORM to prevent user from deleting user with USER_ID = DEV-145. When I delete a line with DEV-145 the system works correctly, but when I select multiple lines, including DEV-145 the system deletes DEV-145 as well. Please give me detailed solutions

 

FORM on_delete.
FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_user_id> TYPE any.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'USER_ID' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_user_id>.

IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_user_id> = 'DEV-145'.

MESSAGE 'Default row DEV-145 cannot be deleted!' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: Avoid rescheduling of Production Order when adding Re...
entry.content:
For the rework, you can add a operation into the original production order, since the work center added which should impact the production order end date.

For this case, you can create a new rework production order, and put the rework operation in it, then it will not impact the original production order.

entry.title: Display Changes to Objects
entry.content:
This analytical application lets you review the recorded field changes for an object.

Screen Areas

Information filter

You can use the information filter at the top of the screen to select which data is displayed in the chart and table. This allows you to view recorded field changes for objects in various ways. You must enter the Object and Time Interval, as they are mandatory filters. Additionally, you can use other filters, such as "Object Component" and "Changed By", among others.

Fig. 2: Filter bar

Visual filter

Visual filter provides a graphical interface for interacting with and filtering your data. It allows you to view and filter the frequency of Changes to Fields based on "Change Type", "Year and Calendar Week" as well as by "Object Component" such as Item or Schedule Line.

Fig. 3: Visual filter bar

Bar chart

The bar chart offers a concise overview of the frequency of specific change fields. By selecting a bar, you can filter the entries in the table. Additionally, utilize the View By filter to explore different dimensional data. You also have the option to change the chart type from the default bar chart for other kinds of charts.

Fig. 4: Bar chart in Hybrid view

Fig. 5: Bar chart in Chart-only view

The "Hybrid view," also referred to as "Chart and Table View," is the default setting that displays both the chart and the table simultaneously. Additionally, you have the option to toggle between "Chart-only view" and "Table-only view" within the chart area.

Fig. 6: Toolbar in chart area

Table

The table located at the bottom of the screen provides additional details regarding the logged changes to objects, including Change Field, Change Type, Object IDs, Changed By, Old Value, and New Value. In the "Settings" button, you have the option to customize the displayed columns to include information such as Object Keys, Activity ID, Source of Data, and more. Additionally, you can utilize the "Group By" and "Sort by" features for the columns.

Fig. 7: Table in Table-only view

Upon clicking on column "Object IDs" you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Events by Business Object".

Fig. 8: Details page of Display Business Events by Business Object

Upon clicking on each row in the "Change Type" column, you are directly directed to the event details page (Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs"),  or a dialog popover appears, displaying concise event information.

Fig. 9: Event Type and Versions in a Dialog

Upon selecting a table entry, you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs".

Fig. 10: Details page of Display Business Event Logs

Release Information

ProductAvailability
SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Public Edition2502 and later
SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Private Edition2025 FPS0 and later
SAP S/4 HANA (On-Premise)2025 FPS0 and later
SAP BTP,  ABAP Environment 2411

Fiori Apps Library Reference

SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Public Edition: https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F8211')/S34

entry.title: 未使用のICFサービスについて
entry.content:
EWAレポートにて、未使用のICFサービスがいるとして報告を受けています。
未使用のICFサービスは可能であれば無効化すべき、とありますが具体的に弊社のシステムにおいてどのICFサービスが未使用かつ無効化可能な対象かわかっていません。

未使用のICFサービスを知るための手順をご教示ください。

How to identify unused ICF services


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: 未使用のICFサービスについて
entry.content:
If the system for that you review the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) Report sends EWA data to SAP, you can open the EarlyWatch Alert Dashboard, accessible via the EWA Workspace in SAP for Me, to enter the details page of the ICF Security chart within the User Experience section. Under the tab "Not used" you find the candidates for deactivation.
Important: Deactivate ICF services of usable apps and reuse libraries only if you are sure they are not utilized. Please double-check the ICF services listed under Not Used before deactivating.
For the deactivation of ICF services a mass processing tool is available. Please refer to SAP Note 2989913.
If you are unable to access the EarlyWatch Alert Dashboard, please refer to SAP Note 2520319.

More details, please refer 3261151 - SAPUI5 Apps - Identify unused ICF services.

entry.title: Re: Single Bonus Payout after Termination and Rehire with...
entry.content:
Hi @RaviUpadhyay 

There is no automated solution for this. By design we calculate payout for each period the employee had under each userID. 

The only way to do this is for customers to handle these cases manually: 

  1. Import both records for both userID from EC
  2. For each employee in this situation find the record from the old country, export its salary/earnings data, convert it into the currency of the new country and sum it up with the salary/earning of the new country record. Then run bonus calculation, and delete the employee history record of the old country.

I looked for workarounds with MDF for this and couldn't find any.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: Find the Bug 🐞 Formatting dates and times in Build Apps
entry.content:
Hello Daniel,

I have used the original formula and just made the changes from date (d) to (D) and got the correct output:

If you want the output to be 9:00 PM CDT, the UTC time should be:

2025-04-03T02:00:00.000Z

Because:
- 2:00 AM UTC − 5 hours = 9:00 PM CDT on April 2

Feel free to send me your comments. will try to resolve.

Thanks,

Vishala.

entry.title: Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup Failing with SDM Parsing Error
entry.content:
Dear SAP SuccessFactors Community,

I currently attempting to implement the Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup via the Upgrade Center. Unfortunately, the job fails with the following error:

Exception occurred while executing class BestPracticesModifySDMWithXMLParser
Exception: BPMsg – Failed to update Succession Data Model.
Reason: Failed to parse data model.
Cleanup initiated before reading the config file.
Final result: False
Upgrade Duration: 6,252 seconds
Outcome: Upgrade Failed – All changes rolled back

📝Notes & Pre-checks Performed:

  1. All picklists are valid and verified in Picklist Center
  2. MDF cache has been cleared from Provisioning
  3. SDM and CSF alignment has been reviewed—for the "fte" element
  4. Deprecated or conflicting blocks removed from the SDM

🔴<hris-element id="directDeposit"/>
🔴<hris-action id="planLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/>
🔴<hris-action id="returnLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/> is removed from the SDM

I've attached both the Succession Data Model (SDM) and Country-Specific SDM (CSF-SDM). Kindly review them and let me know your feedback

⌛The process ran for over an hour before failing

Request for Support❓

Has anyone encountered this issue or have insights into successfully parsing the SDM during this upgrade? Any guidance or workaround to complete the Best Practices setup smoothly would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance 
@SAPSuccessFactors @AllMembers

entry.title: Re: Change of email id against SSO User id
entry.content:
Hi OSS MM, 

For security reasons, we recommend contacting your administrator to update the email ID associated with your S-user ID.  

As per the guidelines outlined in KBA 3108466 - How to update S-user ID e-mail address - SAP for Me, since your S-user is currently linked to a SAP Universal ID, please follow these steps to modify your email address: 

1.Please add the new email ID to your SAP Universal ID via SAP Universal ID Account Manager

2.Once you have completed step 1, please reach out to any Super/Cloud/User Administrator listed in Important Contacts to help you in updating the email ID as per the guidelines outlined in KBA 3108466. 

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

Best regards,
Judy

entry.title: Re: Error while updating Resource Master Data from DTW
entry.content:
Hi  Yoseph

you have to import ORSC and RSC1 template together, even if you only want to change a field of ORSC table. This is the business logic of Resource Master Data.

So, please import ORSC and RSC1 together.

Kind Regards
Nidhi 
SAP Support

entry.title: How can i show a total amount of full year in the story when story has date story filter(YYYY/MM).
entry.content:
The model that i used to SAC story, is planning model with Account dimension.

and the goal is, i will receive the date as a dimension filter(YYYYMM/flat presentation) and show the total value of the year with fixed version like AOP.

ex) when 202503 is entered, i want to show total value 200,000.


202501 - 67,000
202502 - 10,000
202503 - 56,000
.
.
.
202512 - 67,000

-----------------------------------------
=> 200,000

To achieve this, i used the lookup formula in the calculated measure,

but when i use Current("Year") for the Date condition as [LOOKUP([Amount] ,[d/Version]="public.AOP" and [d/Date]=Current("Year" ))] the cell value does not come out(below image).

 



If there is a way to do it, please share it.
Thank you.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent deletion of specific entry in Event 03...
entry.content:
The issue is that your event 03 FORM only checks , which handles single deletions but fails for multiple selections as it doesn't iterate over all marked entries in EXTRACT. To fix this, loop through EXTRACT, check for marked entries ('M' flag) with USER_ID = 'DEV-145', display an info message ('I' like 'E'), and deselect the protected entry by setting its flag to '*'. This prevents DEV-145 deletion while allowing others.

FORM on_delete.

TYPES: BEGIN OF typ_extract,
zsap03_email TYPE zsap03_email,
flags TYPE vimtbflags,
END OF typ_extract.

DATA ls_extract TYPE typ_extract.

LOOP AT extract INTO ls_extract.
IF ls_extract-flags-vim_mark = 'M'.
IF ls_extract-zsap03_email-user_id = 'DEV-145'.
MESSAGE 'Default row DEV-145 cannot be deleted!' TYPE 'I' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ls_extract-flags-vim_mark = '*'.
MODIFY extract FROM ls_extract.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

ENDFORM.

上の回答ではRPAを動かすランタイムは必ずDesktop Agentになりますという話だけ書かせていただきました。

加えて、どういうソリューションがあるのかと言う点に関しては、masa_139 も書いているように、現在具体的にどんなことをやろうとしているのかを記載頂いた方がいいと思います。
SAP Build Process Automationの中にもプロセス（ワークフロー）の機能と自動化（RPA）の機能があり、もしもDesktop Agentを使わない場合でも、プロセス側でできることもありますし、SAP Build Process Automationとは別のツールを使った方がいい場合、カスタムコーディングならでできる場合など色々考えられるので、まずは、実際に実現したいことが何なのか、何をなぜループする必要があるのか、どんなデータがどこから来てどこへ持っていきたいのかなど、できるだけ状況や目的などを記載していただければ、コミュニティでいろんな意見が出せるかと思います。

entry.title: CAP‑ify UI5: Auto‑Loading UI5 Tooling Extensions the CAP Plug‑in Way
entry.content:
I was back at Code Connect this year, first enjoying UI5con and then diving straight into reCAP. Both parts of the event were packed with sharp sessions and brilliant people – if you were there, you know the vibe.

Why CAP plug‑ins made me jealous

During the reCAP tracks I kept noticing how effortlessly SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  plug‑ins integrate: install the package, let the plug‑in declare its events, and the framework picks it up – zero YAML, zero boilerpla

In his keynote @pmuessig  demoed something similar for UI5: a flag --rte for ui5-tooling-modules. It triggers an npm postinstall script that writes the module into ui5.yaml, so you can use it right away. Nice – but my dream is the next step: UI5 tooling extensions that behave like CAP plug‑ins and “just work” after npm install.

Enter ui5-plugin-loader – a Proof of Concept (PoC)

That idea wouldn’t leave me alone, so – still sitting in the Audimax while listening to reCAP Sessions – I hacked together a proof of concept: ui5‑plugin‑loader(npmjs / GitHub Repo).

Disclaimer: The loader is a proof of concept, written for exploration. It’s not production‑ready and doesn’t match the polish of official extensions. Also 100% vibe-coded with ChatGPT and Cursor and claude-4.

What the PoC currently does

  • Scans package.json for UI5 tooling extensions.
  • Loads them in a predictable order (stringreplace → transpile → modules → livereload → rest).
  • Applies sensible defaults, yet lets you disable or override anything via ui5.yaml.
  • Provides fallback manifests for common extensions that do not ship their own.

How it works under the hood

Schema‑driven defaults  
Each extension can ship a ui5-plugin-loader.json that follows a tiny JSON schema. If it does, the loader reads defaults straight from the package. For extensions that don’t, fallback manifests live in the loader itself.

Ordering  
The same schema lets an extension say “run me before X” or “after Y”. The algorithm is simple – good enough for demos, not bullet‑proof for mission‑critical builds.

No public runtime API  
UI5 Tooling 4.0 lacks an official way to register middleware or tasks on the fly, so the loader requires each package directly, calls its factory, and chains the resulting Express handlers. A working hack – but fragile.

Overriding in ui5.yaml

server:
  customMiddleware:
    - name: ui5-plugin-loader
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        disable:
          - ui5-middleware-livereload
        override:
          ui5-tooling-transpile-middleware:
            configuration:
              debug: true
  • disable – turns extensions off.
  • override – patches order or configuration.

Does it run?

Yes. Clone the repo and run the sample app with npm start, and the console shows the loader discovering manifests, loading middlewares, and serving your app. Add or remove an extension in package.json, restart, and watch the chain rearrange itself.

➜  sample-app git:(main) ✗ npm start

> com.pluginloader@1.0.0 start
> ui5 serve --open index.html

info graph:helpers:ui5Framework Using SAPUI5 version: 1.136.3
info server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Starting UI5 Plugin Loader pipeline...
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Unknown configuration key 'configuration' - ignoring
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Unknown configuration key 'middlewareName' - ignoring
info server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Found manifest for ui5-tooling-transpile in fallback directory
info server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Found manifest for ui5-middleware-livereload in fallback directory
info server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Pipeline completed: 2 middleware, 1 tasks (2ms)
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Found 2 middleware configurations, but dynamic registration is not supported.
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader Please configure middleware statically in ui5.yaml using the discovered configurations:
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader   - name: ui5-tooling-transpile-middleware
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader     afterMiddleware: compression
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader   - name: ui5-middleware-livereload
warn server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader     afterMiddleware: compression
info server:custom-middleware:ui5-plugin-loader UI5 Plugin Loader completed: registered 2 middlewares, 1 tasks
Server started
URL: http://localhost:8080

My UI5 Freestyle Typescript App generated with easy-ui5 works!

 

Real‑world value – or not?

The PoC is handy for quick demo apps or internal prototypes where you want TypeScript, modules, and livereload without touching YAML. For serious projects you still end up fine‑tuning ui5.yaml, and the loader cannot hide that complexity. Peter’s approach – let each npm package update ui5.yaml during postinstall – might remain the cleaner path until UI5 Tooling gains native plug‑in discovery.

Another argument against relying on ui5‑plugin‑loader came from the UI5 Tooling team at this year’s UI5con (slides / livestream) . With UI5 CLI v5 (Roadmap) several widely used extensions could become part of the core: the transpile feature, ui5-tooling-modules and ui5-middleware-serveframework (according to the slide deck, even if it wasn’t stated outright).

Once these capabilities ship out of the box, projects will need fewer third‑party extensions and the related entries in ui5.yaml will largely disappear.

 

Questions for the community

  • Should UI5 Tooling grow native plug‑in discovery?
  • Would a shared schema for default config help?
  • Do we need an official runtime registration API?

entry.title: Re: Modify Layout for VA01-VA21-VF01
entry.content:
In the item overview tab (e.g., VA01), click the layout icon (usually a gear icon). Rearrange columns, hide/show fields, and adjust widths as needed. Click Settings → Layout → Save Layout. Give it a name and tick the “Default” checkbox if you want it to be your personal default.

To make it default for all users, you need Admin access. Go to Settings → Layout → Layout Management. Select your layout and mark it as Initial Layout (IL). Save it as a client-wide layout (prefix with / instead of a letter). Transport it if needed to other systems.

entry.title: Re: Order Confirmation change Output type
entry.content:
SAP’s output determination for Order Confirmation Change is notoriously sensitive to which fields are considered “relevant for change.” Not all field modifications will trigger the output type automatically. SAP uses a combination of Change indicator logic, Field catalog configuration and Processing routines tied to the output type. Only changes to fields that are flagged as relevant for output regeneration will trigger the output type

To find out what controls are implemented in your system, Go to transaction NACE → Application V1 (Sales) → Output Types → Select your output type (e.g., BA00 or custom). Check the Processing Routines section. The Program and Form Routine define which fields are monitored.

You can also review SAP Note 395569 for a checklist of change-relevant fields

entry.title: Need to validate the Housebank of Invoices during manual payment in Post Outgoing Payments app
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are working on implementing a custom validation to ensure that during manual payments, house bank selected matches the house bank used in the reference vendor invoice selected for payment. 

To achieve this, we implemented a Custom Logic enhancement using BAdi FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALDATION.

This logic compares the house bank from the current journal entry line with one used in the reference invoice, using the standard CDS view I_JournalEntryItem

We need to block payments if the house bank/ account id used does not match the original invoice's house bank to prevent accounting mismatches.

Our requirement is:

  1. Is BAdi FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALDATION triggered during manual payments posted via the Post Outgoing Payments App?
  2. If not triggered, is there an alternate enhancement point that support this validation.
  3. What is the recommended way to validate or restrict the house bank used in manual payments with reference to invoice data in Public cloud?

Thanks & Regards,

entry.title: Re: GL accounts by item level
entry.content:
Buenas dias,
You could make a formatted search, but then you should use that on all documents in the process.

SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN $[$38.1.0] = 'A00001' THEN '8100' 
        ELSE $[$38.29.0] 
    END

 

You really should consider using the advanced gl determination. It makes the booking process much more flexible. The wizard will create the rules according your current standard determination. Try it in a test environment!

Saludos, Andy

entry.title: Re: Scheduling agreement for intercompany via MRP
entry.content:
Hello,

Scope item 5HP works with purchase order and sales order.

I would suggest to use scheduling agreement Procurement - Sales integrated scenario. Please check the documents (set up instructions) included in 3NR and BMR scope items. Once the communication is set up, when you will create a new schedule line (manually or via MRP) in the Procurement SA in the receiving company, this will be replicated automatically in the Sales SA in the sending company.

entry.title: Send email notification when an existing Termination date changes
entry.content:
We already have an email notification which is sent to a specific group of people via an email address when an employee (who meets specific criteria) is terminated.   This is already working perfectly.   However, we now want to create a separate email notification, which is sent to the same group of people if the Termination Date changes.

For example, Fred Bloggs has been terminated with an effective date in the future of, say 15 August 2025.   A notification is sent to a specific group of people to let them know of the forthcoming termination action.   However, that Termination Date might be brought forward or pushed out to a different date, say 30 August 2025.   When the Termination Date is changed, we want an additional email notification to be sent to the same group of people to let them know there's been a Termination Date change.   The email itself would simply provide the latest Termination Date for that employee, so nothing complex like previous Termination Date and current Termination Date.

I've attempted this numerous times, but the rule created to trigger the workflow (email notification) doesn't trigger.   Has anyone else done this successfully and if so, how did you achieve it?  Some other notable points:

Our Termination Date is configured as part of our employmentInfo HRIS element.   But when we change the Termination Date we essentially Edit the event date which relates to the Termination event directly from within Job Info History.  We then go into the Employment Details portlet (which is NOT effective-dated) and adjust the Payroll End Date and Last Date Worked dates accordingly.

entry.title: Re: PM Order cannot control budget from the WBS element o...
entry.content:
In Public Cloud, PM Orders (account assignment type F) are not inherently budget-controlled via WBS elements. Even if a WBS is assigned to the Functional Location, the PR/PO created from the PM Order doesn’t inherit the WBS for budget availability control. The system checks budget only if the WBS is directly assigned in the account assignment of the PR/PO (e.g., type P).

You can try with some possible below workarounds

  • Instead of standard PM Orders, use Project Orders (account assignment type P). Assign the WBS directly to the order so that all commitments and actuals are tracked against the project budget. This enables Availability Control (AVC) to monitor budget consumption
  • If you're using Developer Extensibility, you can build logic to Automatically derive the WBS from the Functional Location. Inject it into the PR/PO during creation.

entry.title: SAP SUCCESSFACTORS BUG REPORT
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, please find the Details of bug highlighted below. Let me know if you have a Fix!

Details of the BUG:

This Bug has been identified in Change Job and Compensation Information for...  Transaction which only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information. Ideally, this should also select Job and Compensation Information which is the core purpose of the transaction. But the following transaction only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information.

 

There are separate transactions Change Job Information for... and Change Compensation for... transactions which are used for changing Job Information and compensation information separately.

entry.title: Adding @schema to SAP CAP CDS
entry.content:
Hi,

I have two different CAP Apps. 

My goal is to host them on the same PostgreSQl instance in two diffferent schemas

Therefor I added in my db/schema.cds file the annotation

namespace de.test.cap_schema;
using {cuid} from '@sap/cds/common';
@schema: 'schema1'
entity DemoData  : cuid{
       name            : String;
};

In mta.yaml I added the schema as well

resources:
    - name: pgdb
      type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
      parameters:
          service: postgresql-db
          service-plan: trial
          config:
              schema: "schema1"

When I deploy the deployer app for the database, it tries to delete all files from the default database, which was deployed with the first app. The @SCHEMA annoation for second app seems to be useless...

 

Any ideas?
Jens

entry.title: Error during SBO user authentication DI API
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

oCompany.Server = "xxxxxx:30015"; 
oCompany.LicenseServer = "xxxxxx:40000";
oCompany.DbServerType = dst_HANADB;

oCompany.DbUserName = "SYSTEM";
oCompany.DbPassword = "xxxxxxxx";
oCompany.CompanyDB = "TESTSKMC";
oCompany.UserName = "manager";
oCompany.Password = "xxxxxxxx";
oCompany.language = ln_English;
oCompany.UseTrusted = false;

 we are using this code to connect SAP using DIAPI, But we have received the error like "Error during SBO user authentication DI API".

 

How to resolve this one?

entry.title: Re: BAS dev space remains in status "Starting"
entry.content:
Hi,
Thank you for reporting.
The issue was already fixed, please retry running your dev space.

Thanks,
Rotem

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4 Hana public Expected Delivery Notification Alert for a Requestor
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please clarify "They would like the requestor to receive a notification about the expected delivery date for an item that is due to arrive."? What should be the trigger for a notification in this case? For this one "if no receipt has been made after a certain period, a follow-up notification should be sent.", I would suggest to think about event handling in BTP. The overdue PO items are shown in Monitor Purchase Order Items app, so when there is an item set as overdue in that app, this means an event in the system, which can be used to trigger a notification from BTP.

Another variant will be to explore the Manage Situation Type - Extended app with which you can create your own custom situation type.

entry.title: Re: Inquiry About Converting Binary Excel Data to PDF in...
entry.content:
I think you would need third party software / library / script for file conversions. And then in SAP ABAP you can call it via the External OS Commands (SM69).

Here is for example nice blog on how to Convert a PDF file to DOCX format within SAP using Python Script . Very similar way you can achieve your requirement. Also if you search, you can find other usages of SM69 + various external libraries to handle files 🙂

entry.title: In CN41N report incoming Payment & Outgoing payment not showing
entry.content:
Dear Expert ,

Issue Description:
In the CN41N report for a specific project, the incoming and outgoing payments are not being displayed, despite the following steps being completed:

  1. Project Created and Budget Uploaded
  2. Project Released
  3. Auto PR Generated
  4. PO Created
  5. Goods Receipt Created
  6. Goods Issue Posted
  7. Invoice Posted via MIRO
  8. Vendor Payment Executed

entry.title: Uploading attachment with cap-js/attachment plugins but via External App/Postman
entry.content:
If anyone here are struggling uploading attachments via external app to cap-js/attachments, I am writing this blog to showcase how to upload attachments on the plugins via external applications.

The blog shall include:

1. Pre-requisites

2. Example 1. via Postman

3. Example 2. via External App (React)

 

1. Pre-requisites: cap-js/attachment 

You have extended your current entity for example:

Attachment entity accepts the following field below:

The fields above are important and to be used for your JSON Body parameters (can leave status as blank as it uses 'Unscanned' as default). See below sample scenarios on how we can upload attachment:

2. Example 1. (via Postman)

**Other API tools are doable

In this case, we require an existing entry in our table/fiori app.

Here are the steps:

1. Retrieve a single entry from your entity, copy the link and add /YourAttachmentEntity that you extended. (On my case, discount_attachment)

Ex:

2. Follow the entity fields then replicate it, then attach your desired parameters on the body as raw - JSON format

(Convert your file to base64. In my case I attached an image, png format)

3. Send the request, you will see that it responded successfully. Go back to your Fiori app to verify if the attachment reflected:

 

3. Example 2. (External App)

I have developed a React App for POC purposes. In this scenario, the data should be created first, then update that same entry using the ID, then upload the attachment via HTTP POST.  Let's breakdown:

1. Upload attachment as input='file', bind it in form data including all the parameters:

2. Build your logic for your initial creation. 

Note: My .ENV variable contains the base odata URL (/odata/v4/......, not the whole http url)

3. Convert the file from input='file' to base64 via JS logic, then bind the OData URL with your entity keys and the HTTP body parameters (refer to Attachment Entity fields and Postman example above).  then proceed OData call

My form will display a successful message and it should reflect on the database/fiori app as well.

Conclusion: 

This blog demonstrates how SAP CAP can interface seamlessly with external apps to enhance attachment handling across varied use cases. By abstracting the upload and retrieval logic via an API layer, the approach supports modular features in both admin dashboards and customer-facing applications. Despite initial challenges around payload structuring and authorization, the solution remains scalable, secure, and adaptable to different frontend contexts.

Let me know if you have any further questions or wish to communicate, just comment below the comment section.

entry.title: Re: Changing LGORT for WM Staging (CO02/LB10)
entry.content:
LTAP_CREATE_TR or LTA_CREATE_TR: Aren't existing, I've found L_TO_CREATE_TR but it won't get called at all
BADI_LE_WM_STAGING: Also not found, not even a similar sounding one

Any other solutions?

entry.title: Exposing SAP S4 Onprem data to external System || Odata Service || BTP || Destination-Connectivity
entry.content:
Prerequisites from BTP Side

  1. SAP BTP Account
    • Access to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) with appropriate entitlements.
  2. SAP Cloud Connector Setup
    • SAP Cloud Connector installed and configured to connect your on-premise S/4HANA system to SAP BTP.
    • Destination configured in BTP cockpit pointing to your on-premise system.
  3. Connectivity Service and Destination Service
    • SAP BTP Connectivity service and destination service instance on the BTP account.
  4. Cloud Foundry Environment
    • Cloud Foundry space set up in your BTP subaccount to deploy the application.

Use Case:

Lets take a simple use case for creating a RAP service on S4, which is a wrapper API call on the reprocess IDOC function module.

For this we will create a RAP service on the S4 box, than activate the service with the /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE and activate the ICF Node as well.

Note: In this blog we will not go through the steps of setting cloud connector and destination on the BTP account. We will assume that destination with cloud connector setup is already available on the BTP. 

Step 1: Create and activate the RAP service on the S4 Box.

 We will create a unmanaged rap scenario with custom entity and than we will create a service definition and top of service definition we will create service binding.

Lets create the class for the query implementation.

 

We are calling the FM to reprocess the idoc and checking the relevant table to get the latest reprocessed idoc status for the same.

Now we will create a service definition and service binding for the custom entity created.

Service Definition

And overall project will look something like this.

Here i have created two types of service bindings v2 and v4 but we will be using only v2 for this.

So overall we created below 4 artifacts.

1. Custom entity

2. Class

3. Service definition

4. Service binding

Now to test the service we will publish the service first and than call the generated url

if you see the image, i have published the service and after publish we also got the custom entity that we have created, click on the service url and it will open in browser asking for authentication of S4 user id and password.

Once the authentication is successful you should be able to see this.

Now lets open the SAP GUI so that i can show you the ICF node activation, which is generally taken care by basis team.

Open the Tcode: /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE

Here you can find your activated service binding and make sure all components of the service looks as it is in the image.

Assuming cloud connector and destination is setup on BTP.

With this we completed the S4 box setup, now its ready to communicate with other external systems.

Step 2: Creating the Destination service and Connectivity service on the BTP Account.

Login in to BTP account and lets create 2 service instances with service keys.

1. Destination service, this will help us to get the destination details, Destination service gets all the registered destinations on the BTP, from which we can filter out the destination that is up for our S4 onprem box.

Destination service will give us all the relevant things like user id passwd, location and etc. for that destination.

Service key for the destination service

2. Connectivity Service, Since we are trying to get the data out of onprem system we will have to use connectivity service from btp, which will provide us proxies, this proxies will be use to call the onprem odata url.

It is important to paste here the service keys for better understanding since we will be using many things from the service key into our application

Step 3: Lets create a python application to call the onprem service.

Important things to consider here.

By using destination and connectivity service we cannot test the application on local system, we will have to deploy our app on CF to test the same.

We will use the flask requests and certain other libraries for the python programming

file: .env file to store all the secrets this secrets are from the service keys only.

 

File: Requirements.txt

File: Runtime.txt

python-3.11.*

file: manifest.yaml

file:idocapis.py (should be same as mentioned in Manifest.yml file

Load all the required libraries.

define the function to get the token

Define function to get the list of all destinations on the BTP

Define the function to construct the URL for the odata call

Define function to get token for the connectivity service

Define function to call the odata service with connectivity things

Now lets define the final route in flask to call this service

One thing to note here the RESOURCE variable will depend on the destination url of the onprem that is setup on BTP.

 

STEP 4: Deployment

Lets deploy the app on the CF by pushing the app to the cloud foundry from the BAS

Use command cf push after successful authentication for your cloud foundry space.

After the deployment on the cloud we can get the url that is generated on the cloud.

Testing the application:

Lets create a small python program to call this API in local now to test it.

You should get response coming from your S4 onPrem system.

Thanks for staying till the end!!!😊

entry.title: Re: Publish/Activate an oData V4 Service Group in SAP
entry.content: With S4HANA 2022 , publishing the OData V4 does create a customizing TR which can be used to move the changes across the clients and landscape.
